text: Thanks, I can confirm I now have the drag/drop functionality in the sandbox portal!

Hi all, is anybody having experience with a SSO and giving only one person acces to a certain dynamic page?
For instance: we generate profile pages via dynamic content and want only the person itself have acces to the page?
Hope to hear from you.
We don't have the feature to control the access for certain dynamic pages only.

oke, Gobi, Thanks for your reply.
Is there a workaround? don't use dynamicpages, but maybe a hubdb?
Yea, you can use HubL to retrieve only the required row from table in the template and create a normal page with that template and you will have all membership options
Thanks <@UG52C29EE> And what happens if you exceed the 10.000 rows of a hubdb?
Or is it an option to check if the current loggedin user has the same id as the id of the dynamic page? Could that be a workaround?
Thanks for your help <@U021JKWA1GB> I discoverd that i need to use an API to get the custom object.

You can access `hs_id`  of the rows retrieved from HubL function and then you can manually validate them in the template against whatever you want. Also the max limit for a table is 10K rows.  You either need to create multiple tables and manage it yourself or create custom objects in CRM
Sorry if I misunderstood your question
Another issue is the search engine's "crawling budget". It's limited, so we want to use its resources carefully.
